required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Relative Bioavailability Study Between Two Formulations Of Sildenafil Citrate
clinical_study.official_title: A Relative Bioavailability Study Between Two Formulations Of Sildenafil Citrate In Healthy Male Subjects, Fasting Dosing, Being The Test Formulation Sildenafil Citrate 100 Mg CT , And The Reference Formulation Sildenafil Citrate 100 Mg Film-Coated Tablets (Viagra®), Both Formulations Manufactured By Laboratórios Pfizer Ltda.

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to perform a relative bioavailability study between two formulations of sildenafil citrate.

detailed_description.textblock: Bio-equivalence between two formulations of sildenafil citrate

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Period 1), Day 8 (Period 2), and Day 15 (Period 3): Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 12 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Area under the blood concentration-time profile from time zero to last experimentally determined concentration measured in nanograms*hour/milliliter (ng*hr/mL).

primary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Period 1), Day 8 (Period 2), and Day 15 (Period 3): Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 12 hours post-dose
primary_outcome.description: Maximum plasma concentration measured in nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Curve From 0 to Infinity (AUC 0-inf )
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Period 1), Day 8 (Period 2), and Day 15 (Period 3): Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 12 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the blood concentration-time profile from time zero extrapolated to infinite time measured in nanograms *hour/milliliter (ng*hr/mL).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Period 1), Day 8 (Period 2), and Day 15 (Period 3): Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 12 hours post-dose
secondary_outcome.description: Time at which maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) occurred.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Period 1), Day 8 (Period 2), and Day 15 (Period 3): Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 12 hours post-dose

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Findings in Vital Signs
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Period 1), Day 8 (Period 2), and Day 15 (Period 3): Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8 and 12 hours post-dose.
secondary_outcome.description: Clinically significant abnormalities in blood pressure (BP), pulse, and temperature reported as an adverse event. Clinically significant = values outside the normal range and/or values judged as significant by the investigator (normal range: systolic BP 100-140 mmHg; diastolic BP 60- 90 mmHg; temperature 35-37°Celsius). Pulse rate based on investigator discretion.

intervention.description: sildenafil citrate 100 mg CT, single dose without water
sildenafil citrate 100 mg CT, single dose with water
sildenafil citrate 100 mg film-coated tablet (Viagra®), single dose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body mass index higher or equal to 18,5 and lower or equal than 29,9 kg/m2.
- Good health conditions or without significant disease, at medical discretion, according to the rules defined in the Protocol, and evaluations undergone: clinical history, pulse and blood pressure measurements, physical and psychological examination, ECG and complementary laboratory examination.
- Able to understand the study nature and objective, including the risks and adverse effects and willing to cooperate with the investigator and act according to all the trial requirements, which is confirmed by signing the Informed Consent Form.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Hypersensitivity to the study drug or to the chemically related compounds; history of serious adverse reactions or hypersensitivity to any drug.
- History or presence of hepatic or gastrointestinal diseases, or other condition that affects the drug absorption, distribution, excretion or metabolism
- History of hepatic, renal, lung, gastrointestinal, epileptic, hematological or psychiatric disease; hypo or hypertension of whatever etiology which demands treatment with drugs; history or occurrence of myocardial infarction, angina and/or cardiac failure;

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: Each participant was to receive each of 3 formulations in 3 treatment periods, after being allocated to 1 of 6 treatment sequences. There was to be a minimum interval of 3 days between treatment periods.

group.title: Sequence 1
group.description: Reference (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) coated tablet administered with water, Test 1 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered without water), Test 2 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered with water)

group.title: Sequence 2
group.description: Reference (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) coated tablet administered with water, Test 2 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered with water), Test 1 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered without water)

group.title: Sequence 3
group.description: Test 1 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered without water), Reference (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) coated tablet administered with water, Test 2 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered with water)

group.title: Sequence 4
group.description: Test 1 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered without water), Test 2 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered with water), Reference (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) coated tablet administered with water

group.title: Sequence 5
group.description: Test 2 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered with water), Reference (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) coated tablet administered with water, Test 1 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered without water)

group.title: Sequence 6
group.description: Test 2 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered with water), Test 1 (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered without water), Reference (Sildenafil 100 milligram (mg) coated tablet administered with water

participants_list.participants: 1 participant randomized to this sequence discontinued prior to receipt of study medication.

group.title: Entire Study Population
group.description: Includes all participants who were randomized to any treatment sequence

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve (AUC 0-t)
outcome.description: Area under the blood concentration-time profile from time zero to last experimentally determined concentration measured in nanograms*hour/milliliter (ng*hr/mL).
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Period 1), Day 8 (Period 2), and Day 15 (Period 3): Pre-dose and 0.25, 0.5, 0.75, 1, 1.25, 1.5, 1.75, 2, 2.5, 3, 4, 5, 6, 8, and 12 hours post-dose
outcome.population: Participants for pharmacokinetic analysis = participants who completed all of the 3 treatment periods.

group.title: Test 1: 100 mg Chewable, Without Water
group.description: Test 1 Formulation: Sildenafil citrate 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered without water

group.title: Test 2: 100 mg Chewable, With Water

group.title: Reference: 100 mg Coated, With Water
group.description: Reference Formulation: Viagra (sildenafil citrate) 100 mg coated tablet administered with water

measure.title: Area Under the Curve (AUC 0-t)
measure.description: Area under the blood concentration-time profile from time zero to last experimentally determined concentration measured in nanograms*hour/milliliter (ng*hr/mL).
measure.population: Participants for pharmacokinetic analysis = participants who completed all of the 3 treatment periods.

analysis.groups_desc: Ratio between geometric means of Test 1 study treatment (chewable without water) and reference study treatment (coated with water).
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Percent of reference to detect for 2-1 tests and power = 20.0%.

analysis.groups_desc: Ratio between geometric means of Test 2 study treatment (chewable with water) and reference study treatment (coated with water).
analysis.non_inferiority_desc: Percent of reference to detect for 2-1 tests and power = 20.0%.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Findings in Vital Signs
outcome.description: Clinically significant abnormalities in blood pressure (BP), pulse, and temperature reported as an adverse event. Clinically significant = values outside the normal range and/or values judged as significant by the investigator (normal range: systolic BP 100-140 mmHg; diastolic BP 60- 90 mmHg; temperature 35-37°Celsius). Pulse rate based on investigator discretion.
outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (Period 1), Day 8 (Period 2), and Day 15 (Period 3): Pre-dose and 0.5, 1, 2, 4, 8 and 12 hours post-dose.
outcome.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Although individual listing data for vital signs were collected, summary statistics were not generated for this outcome measure.

group.title: Test 1: 100 mg Chewable, Without Water
group.description: Test 1 Formulation: Sildenafil citrate 100 milligram (mg) chewable tablet administered without water

group.title: Reference: 100 mg Coated, With Water
group.description: Reference Formulation: Viagra (sildenafil citrate) 100 mg coated tablet administered with water

measure.title: Number of Participants With Clinically Significant Findings in Vital Signs
measure.description: Clinically significant abnormalities in blood pressure (BP), pulse, and temperature reported as an adverse event. Clinically significant = values outside the normal range and/or values judged as significant by the investigator (normal range: systolic BP 100-140 mmHg; diastolic BP 60- 90 mmHg; temperature 35-37°Celsius). Pulse rate based on investigator discretion.
measure.population: Safety population: all subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication. Although individual listing data for vital signs were collected, summary statistics were not generated for this outcome measure.

reported_events.desc: Safety population: subjects who received at least 1 dose of study medication in any treatment period. An Adverse Event (AE) term may be reported as both a serious and non-serious AE, but are distinct events. AE may = serious for 1 subject and non-serious for another subject or subject may have had a serious and non-serious episode of same event.

event.sub_title: Laboratory change: red blood cell count

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
